title: Armando Solar-Lezama named inaugural Distinguished Professor of Computing
summary: Armando Solar-Lezama has been named the inaugural Distinguished Professor of Computing at the MIT Stephen A. Schwarzman College of Computing. The position was generously endowed by Professor Jae S. Lim and is awarded to Solar-Lezama for his outstanding contributions as a faculty member and leader in the field. Solar-Lezama is a professor of electrical engineering and computer science and leads the Computer-Aided Programming Group at MIT. His research focuses on program synthesis, which involves automating challenging aspects of programming.
